creditline: Gift of the Alfred K. Moir Trust
description: slightly abstracted view of tall, thin tree trunks, yellow and green foliage and blue sky
marks: Signature, Date and Label LLC of image, in pencil: [Jean Seidenberg]; LRC of
text: Jean Seidenberg found these southern pines near the Wolf River in Mississippi. It was during a sultry, humid weekend in June while visiting his friend Evelyn Witherspoon, who had a cottage in the little town of Kiln. Open-air sketches are rare for him because of the mosquitoes, he said, but when he does them, “I always do exactly what I see.” Here, he said, he saw the forms of the 19th-century French painter Cézanne.
title: View from Evelyn's III
